messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
I don't know. A girl came running to my house just a second ago. She said someone was going to die.
How long ago was this?
About two minutes ago.
Do you know her?
Yeah, she's my neighbor.
How did he look?
I didn't see him. She said someone was outside her house, threatening her.
Is she with you now?
No, she's outside. Hold on a second.
Hello, are you still there?
Hold on.
Hello, hi.
Was the person on foot or in a vehicle?
Who's on foot?
Which direction did they go? Do you know if it was north, south, east, or west?
I didn't get a chance to see. I just ran.
About how old did they look?
Young, maybe 20s, mid-20s.
What race were they? White, Black, Hispanic?
He was Black.
About how tall and how much did he weigh?
I'm not sure. He had sunglasses on and braids.
Would you describe him as thin, medium, or heavy build?
Thin, maybe.
You said he had sunglasses. What color were they?
Black sunglasses.
And what color cap did he have?
A black baseball cap.
What color shirt did he have on?
Black.
What color pants?
Black.
And you don't know which direction he went?
No.
How old are you?
Did he say anything to you?
Yes, when I went to get my phone, he told me not to.
You went to get your phone and he told you not to?
Yeah, I was on the road.
Were you outside?
I was inside my house when he came in.
He came into your house?
Yes, he came inside my house and was looking everywhere.
Hold on for a second, okay?
Okay.
Do you know what kind of gun it was? Was it a handgun or a rifle?
It was a black pistol.
Did he have it in his hand, or where was it?
It was in his hand. He was pointing it at me.
And you didn't see which direction he went at all?
No, he just came inside my house and was looking everywhere.
Is there anything else that you remember about him?
He had a backpack on.
